Package javelin.controller

Class InfiniteList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.InfiniteList<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventDealer.EventDeck
    public class InfiniteList<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Taking a collection of items during or after construction, will serve those items until exhausted, at which point will refill itself with the same items - thus providing a seemingly inexhaustible stream of content. Internally, this class contains two pools: the content pool (the original items, to be served indefinitely) and the current pool (or temporary pool, which is the current state of items to be delivered). Whenever an item is requested and the current pool is empty, it is first transparently refilled with the items from the content pool.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
